body_html:
So as far as I can tell, the main difference is that I might need to AutoNoGIL but I think I don't need to do the DeviceGuard myself.
The next thing is that I think I can do the same trick for new_with_tensor_copy by using the copy flag for Tensor.to.

But then there is @ezyang 's very recent comment

TODO: It would be better if new_with_tensor_copy took an at::Device
to begin with, but then we need to fix the situation with
dispatch_type_conversion bleggg

which I don't fully know I understand.
@ezyang Should I be more careful?

body:
So as far as I can tell, the main difference is that I might need to `AutoNoGIL` but I think I don't need to do the `DeviceGuard` myself.
The next thing is that I think I can do the same trick for `new_with_tensor_copy` by using the `copy` flag for `Tensor.to`.

But then there is @ezyang 's very recent comment 
> TODO: It would be better if new_with_tensor_copy took an at::Device
>  to begin with, but then we need to fix the situation with
> dispatch_type_conversion bleggg

which I don't fully know I understand.
@ezyang Should I be more careful?
